description: This table will extract Patient FYI flags from the Notes (HNO) database. These are notes with a Patient Flag Type (I HNO 560) that is not null.

columns.name: NOTE_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the note (HNO)

columns.name: DELETED_CAT_C_NAME
columns.description:
Indicates the Deleted Status of this Note record in Chronicles.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


DELETED


Hidden


DELETED and Hidden

columns.name: ACTIVE_C_NAME
columns.description:
Indicates if this Patient FYI Flag will be shown as an Active or Inactive flag.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Active


Inactive

columns.name: ENTRY_PERSON_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the user (EMP) who created this Patient FYI Flag.

columns.name: ACCT_NOTE_INSTANT
columns.description: The instant at which this FYI flag was created.

columns.name: ACCT_NOTE_SUMMARY
columns.description: The brief free text summary statement about the Patient FYI.

columns.name: PAT_FLAG_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The type of Patient FYI Flag. This is a customer owned list.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


General


Release Restrictions


Sedation


Legal Review


Externally-Entered Coverage


Tracked


Locked


Restricted Data


Test Patient


Deprecated - Drug Seeker


Deprecated - Research Participant


Radiation Therapy Patient


Opt Out of Payer Record Exchange


PCP Change


CMS RO Model


CP-IS: Child Protection Plan


CP-IS: Looked After Child


CP-IS: Unborn Child Protection Plan


Protection Order


Custody


Compliance Packager Patient


NEHR Patient Properties

columns.name: PT_FG_PURGABLE_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether a batch can purge this patient flag. A Y indicates the flag can be purged. N indicates the flag cannot be purged.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No

columns.name: PAT_ENC_CSN_ID
columns.description: The Patient Encounter this Patient FYI is associated with.  This field may be null, if the FYI is at the patient level rather than contact specific.
